column5: We have this art show every year in Louisville Kentucky in the fall. There is this lady who takes actual fish and uses clay to make a mold of the fish. Then they paint the mold and they look really nice. Every year we pick a few. They go pretty fast so we got to get to the art show early. My favorite one is the walleye. But we also have a largemouth, crappie, sunfish and a sheephead. Does any body else have any type of fish art pictures that they want to share?
Those are pretty cool Matt I have a couple of mounts but no fish art.  Whopper
some of the work my wife does
wow knotaclue, your wife does some nice work!!  Maureen
knotaclue, that painting is incredible, almost looks like a photograph.  Maybe post a few more of your wifes paintings ??
That is a beautiful painting! Like Lew said, it almost looks like its a real photograph.
Search Larry Tople.  He's possibly one of the best painters I've come across.
every time she paints one of a fish for me .she sells it! here are a couple more. this is what she does for a living,most of the time she paints on slate.
Thanks for posting those pictures knotaclue, VERY VERY nice indeed, and your definetely married to an extremely talented lady
I agree knotaclue, those are amazing!
Excellent artwork knotaclue. You have a very talented wife.  Thanks for sharing.  I don't have anything that would remotely resemble the artwork seen here
Knotaclue,  does your wife have a website, I would love to see some more!  If she doesn't she needs to get one!
Those really are very good, knotaclue! A very talented Wife!
